greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = number of integers in range [2^(n-1),(2^n)-1] which permutation A209861/A209862 sends to even-sized orbits.
comment: a(0) gives the number of even-sized cycles in range [0,0], i.e. 0, as there is only one fixed point in that range.
example: In range [2^(6-1),(2^6)-1] ([32,63]) of permutations A209861 & A209862, there are 6 cycles of size 1 (six fixed points), 2 cycles of size 3, one cycle of size 4, and 2 cycles of size 8, i.e. 6*1 + 2*3 + 1*4 + 2*8 = 32 in total, of which 4 + 2*8 elements are in even-sized cycles, thus a(6)=20.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 24 2012
